Can I use the `listunspent` command with a JSON RPC interface in Verus?

Yes, you can use the `listunspent` command with a JSON RPC interface in Verus. For example, you can use `curl` to send a JSON RPC request to the Verus server, like this: `curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "listunspent", "params": [6, 9999999 "["RD6GgnrMpPaTSMn8vai6yiGA7mN4QGPV","RD6GgnrMpPaTSMn8vai6yiGA7mN4QGPV"]"] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/`.

Examples
> verus listunspent 
> verus listunspent 6 9999999 "["RD6GgnrMpPaTSMn8vai6yiGA7mN4QGPV","RD6GgnrMpPaTSMn8vai6yiGA7mN4QGPV"]"
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "listunspent", "params": [6, 9999999 "["RD6GgnrMpPaTSMn8vai6yiGA7mN4QGPV","RD6GgnrMpPaTSMn8vai6yiGA7mN4QGPV"]"] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
